level.text: A Board of Review (also referred to in this chapter as the “Board”), as established by the Mayor, shall consist of the following:
The Corporation Counsel or an alternate designated by the Corporation Counsel;
The Director of the Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs or an alternate designated by the Director; and
A public member who shall be an attorney and a member of the District of Columbia Bar designated by the President of the District of Columbia Bar.
The Corporation Counsel or his or her designated alternate shall be the chairperson of the Board.
The Office of the Secretary of the District of Columbia shall provide the necessary administrative services for the Board.
The Board of Review shall do the following:
Receive petitions for review sent to the Secretary of the District of Columbia;
Hold hearings on the issues involved in each case; and
Make a final determination in each case.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: §§ 21.1 and 21.2 of Regulation No. 73-13, approved May 24, 1973, 19 DCR 1147, 1149 (June 11, 1973), 25 DCRR §§ 21.1 and 21.2.
